medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports abdominal pain since yesterday at 7:30. The pain was severe overnight and has improved with morphine this morning but is starting to become worse again. The pain is described as located all over the lower abdomen and in the center/left back, particularly intense in the infraumbilical region. The patient also experiences mild nausea but no vomiting. There are no fevers, chills, diarrhea, or constipation, and the last bowel movement was normal.
